class_notes:
Asynchronous material included.
This course is designed for the study of Relationships in the performance
	of dramatic scenes both from script and improvisation. This process-oriented
	course will focus on the development of character and role interactions through
	Principles of Text Analysis, Objective/Obstacle, Circumstance, Behavior and 
	Manner, Action/Activity, and Emotional development and exchange. As a
	performance based course, there will be a variety of exercises and task involving
	work with a partner as well as solo presentation, including both graded and
	non-graded assignments. Scenes will include both contemporary dramatic
	literature, film, and Shakespeare. Attendance, participation, preparation, focus,
	cooperation and respect for each other are required.
course_description: An introduction to the challenges of acting scenes. This process-oriented course will focus on the development of character relationship through principles of objective, circumstance, habit, activity, age, and emotion.
prerequisites: This course requires THEA 120 OR THEA_OX 121 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
